{"step_by_step_thinking": "A functional implant refers to a dental implant that is in use, meaning it is supporting a prosthetic tooth and is under the normal forces of chewing. After the first year of placement, the bone loss around a functional implant should be minimal. If the bone loss is too much, it could indicate a problem such as peri-implantitis. According to the literature, the acceptable bone loss after the first year of implant placement is less than 0.2 mm annually.", "answer_choice": "B. Less than 0.1 mm"}
